alert.note: Alert for Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 22 at 4:33PM EST until December 24 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches, highest in northeast Porter County north of Interstate 80. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph expected. Wind chill values of 25 to 35 below zero expected. * WHERE...Porter County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Falling and blowing snow will result in white out conditions with zero visibility at times, making travel extremely difficult, if not impossible. Power outages will also be possible as a result of strong wind gusts to 55 mph. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 25 to 35 below zero tonight through Friday night can cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 20 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1- 800-261-7623.
